page.title: 15Customs in Rogate
page.content: There is a story of how in 1748 one Williiam Galley a custom officer was murdered and his body stuffed down a well. Popular legend has it that his horse was also pushed down after him. The well is on site at Galley Grove but a modern arch covers its depth. An elderly resident, tells of one story current when she kept The White Horse public house, of highway men who escaped the law and hid in the cellars. The policemen walked up and down outside still wondering what had happened to the men. Finding some women's clothes in a basket the thieves dressed themselves up and walked boldly out and away. The village band has also had its strange moments when it became so drunk that it spent some time entertaining a haystack thinking it was a house.
